column4: man, this is pissing me off. I still cant get my sound to work after hibernation.
come on good smart people, get together and help me out :-)
the worst thing is, i never use hibernation, i clicked it by mistake.
try running this: sudo alsa force-reload
i already tried that. I rebooted computer, tried different kernel ver... still nothing.
have you ran alsamixer to check if they were muted, i have forgotten to check this a few times
there is some pulseoudio setting somewhere that got corupted when hibernated. And i cant figure it out.
yes, several times.
is pulseaudio seeing your hardware?
pulseoudio or my system? When i open pavucontrol and play some music, the sound bar is moving, so it looks like it is recognized, it just does not give any output.
kernel moudule/driver loaded i check with lspci -k.
install padevchooser and that should tell you if it is connecting to a sound device or /dev/null
i have it already, let me fire it up.
connection refused.
sounds like pulseaudio isn't running
hold up, i might killed it when trying to fix it.
ok, restarted pulseaudio, it is connected. (C-Media CMI8770 PCI)
are you still there?
yeah.
yeah, i did. and volume meter shows activity, i hear no sound.
yes, master and PCM are all unmuted and up to max.
i dont know
do you think completely reinstalling pulseaudio might help?
i'll go and add another user, and see what happens there.
